column3: He clearly has no intention of speaking with you.

I know who you are. <Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, champion of Eorzea, yes? Our orders are to give you the run of our encampment, but I have my eye on you. So, what business do you have with me?

Lord Quintus was our rock in the storm...and now, we are without a leader, without direction. Nevertheless, we must live on, even if that means consorting with our former enemies. Well, what do you want?
The end has come, and we are powerless to resist. Are you here to bear witness to Garlemald's demise, or is there some other reason?

The Final Days your comrades speak of have been averted, and we yet live. Even now, the words of Lord Quintus serve as our inspiration, as we march into a new era. But tell me, is there aught you wish to know?
What kind of place is this?
I am Decimus, centurion of the Ist Legion. It is my sworn duty to defend Garlemald from barbarians such as you, and your very presence here is an affront to my honor.
I am Decimus, centurion of the Ist Legion. Although my legatus is no more, I will continue to defend this last bastion and those who seek refuge here.

I am Decimus, centurion of the Ist Legion. Or at least, I was. With the Empire fallen and our glorious capital in ruins, what meaning have such appellations? Even so, I remain a Garlean and I require neither rank nor station to defend my people.
This is Tertium, third among the stations that encircle the city. The decommissioned carriages here now serve as the Ist Legion's temporary base of operations.

It has also become a safe haven for those fleeing the turmoil that has befallen the capital. What scant supplies we have are distributed among civilian and soldier alike, and we strive to maintain some semblance of order in these dark times.

Our true objective, however, is not merely to survive, but to reclaim our home. We have no time to deal with your band of savages, and if you dare to interfere in our affairs, we will not hesitate to cut you down.
Our dream of taking back the city lies in tatters, but we shall fight on until the bitter end. I only hope that those who have fled will fare better than I and my men.
While we may have been spared the cataclysm, our struggle continues. With the words of Lord Quintus to guide us, we will rebuild and start anew.
For affording us this second chance, you have my sincerest gratitude.
